# MKUserLocationView

**Class**

A configurable annotation that shows the user’s location using the default MapKit style.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class MKUserLocationView
```

## Overview

If you don’t need additional configuration, you can show an annotation with the user’s location by setting [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKMapView/showsUserLocation] on the map to `true`.

If you want to specify additional configuration, such as [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKAnnotationView/zPriority], create this annotation view directly. To display the annotation view, return the instance from [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKMapViewDelegate/mapView(_:viewFor:)-8humz].

The user location view provides the MapKit default style and behavior. The visual display varies with the level of authorization the user grants your app.

## User location

- **Converting a user’s location to a descriptive placemark**: Transform the user’s location that displays on a map into an informative textual description by reverse geocoding.
- **MKUserLocation**: An annotation that reflects the user’s location on the map.
